citation.article-title: Lactobacillus fuchuensis sp. nov., isolated from vacuum-packaged refrigerated beef.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus fuchuensis sp. nov.
Lactobacillus fuchuensis (fu.chu.en'sis. N.L. adj. fuchuensis of Fuchu, the city in which the bacterium was
originally isolated)
Cells are Gram-positive, straight and curved rods, occurring singly, in pairs or short chains.
Cells are 0.5-0.75 μm in width and 2.6 μm in length.
Cells are non-spore-forming and non-motile.
Colonies on MRS agar plates after 48 h are small, about 1.0-2.0 mm in diameter, smooth, entire convex and cream-coloured.
Facultatively anaerobic.
Catalase- and oxidase-negative.
No growth is observed at 37 °C in MRS broth after 48 h incubation or on acetate agar (pH 5.4).
No gas is produced from glucose or gluconate.

Acid is produced from N-acetyl β-glucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, cellobiose, aesculin, D-fructose, galactose, β-gentiobiose, gluconate, D-glucose, lactose, maltose, D-mannose, methyl β-D-glucopyranoside, rhamnose, ribose, salicin, starch, D-tagatose, trehalose and D-xylose.

Acid is not produced from adonitol, D-arabinose, L-arabinose, D-arabitol, L-arabitol, cyclodextrin, dulcitol, erythritol, D-fucose, L-fucose, glycogen, inositol, inulin, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, D-lyxose, mannitol, melezitose, melibiose, methyl α-D-glucoside, methyl α-D-mannoside, methyl β-xyloside, pullulan, D-raffinose, sorbitol, L-sorbose, sucrose, xylitol or L-xylose.
Some strains produce acid from glycerol and D-turanose.
Alanine-phenylalanine-proline arylamidase, arginine dehydrolase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, glycyl-tryptophan arylamidase and β-mannosidase activities are detected.
No activity for β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-galactosidase, alkaline phosphatase or pyrrolidonyl arylamidase is detected.
Hippurate is not hydrolysed.
Nitrate is not reduced.
Acetoin is produced weakly.
Urease is not produced.
m-DAP is not detected in the cell wall.
A predominant amount of L-(+­)-lactate isomer plus a small amount of the D-(-) isomer are produced.
The mean G­C content of DNA is 41.4 mol%.
Isolated
from vacuum-packaged refrigerated beef.
Habitat is not known.
The type strain is B5M10T (=JCM 11249T=DSM 14340T).
The description of the type strain corresponds to that of the species except that acid is not produced from glycerol or D-turanose.
